metadata.title: CVE-2015-7510 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the getpwnam and getgrnam functions of theNSS module nss-mymachines in systemd.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7510` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu4
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu4
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu4
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu4
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu4
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu4
systemd - 229-4ubuntu4
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu4
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu4
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu4
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu4
udev - 229-4ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu4').
